Bob Lanier

Pronunciation: \luh-NEER\

Robert Jerry Lanier Jr.

(Dobber, Moses, Bob-A-Dob)

Position: Center Shoots: Left

6-11, 250lb (211cm, 113kg)

Born: September 10, 1948 in Buffalo, New York us

Died: May 10, 2022 (Aged 73-242d)

College: St. Bonaventure

High School: Bennett in Buffalo, New York

Draft: Detroit Pistons, 1st round (1st pick, 1st overall), 1970 NBA Draft

NBA Debut: October 14, 1970

Hall of Fame: Inducted as Player in 1992 (Full List)

Career Length: 14 years

Transactions

March 23, 1970: Drafted by the Detroit Pistons in the 1st round (1st pick) of the 1970 NBA Draft.

February 4, 1980: Traded by the Detroit Pistons to the Milwaukee Bucks for Kent Benson and a 1980 1st round draft pick (Larry Drew was later selected).

September 24, 1984: Retired from the Milwaukee Bucks.

Frequently Asked Questions

Where was Bob Lanier born?

Bob Lanier was born in Buffalo, New York.

When was Bob Lanier born?

Bob Lanier was born on September 10, 1948.

How tall was Bob Lanier?

Bob Lanier was 6-11 (211 cm) tall.

How much did Bob Lanier weigh when playing?

Bob Lanier weighed 250 lbs (113 kg) when playing.

Is Bob Lanier in the Hall of Fame?

Bob Lanier was inducted to the Hall of Fame as a Player in 1992 (Full List) .

When was Bob Lanier drafted?

Bob Lanier was drafted by Detroit Pistons, 1st round (1st pick, 1st overall), 1970 NBA Draft.

What position did Bob Lanier play?

Center.

When did Bob Lanier retire?

Bob Lanier last played in 1984.

What did Bob Lanier average?

Bob Lanier averaged 20.1 points, 10.1 rebounds, and 3.1 assists per game.

How many rings does Bob Lanier have?

Bob Lanier won 0 championships.

What schools did Bob Lanier attend?

Bob Lanier attended Bennett in Buffalo, New York and St. Bonaventure.

What are Bob Lanier's nicknames?

Dobber, Moses, Bob-A-Dob are nicknames for Bob Lanier.
